basics.name: David Park
basics.label: Data Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced Data Manager with a demonstrated history of working in the local government and healthcare industries with a passion for automation and open source software. Skilled in Python and C# and associated IDEs and packages. Strong information technology professional with a Games Programming first-class honours degree from Northumbria University. Please see the Featured section for projects I have contributed to.

work.name: NHS England
highlights: Playing an integral role in the daily operations of NHS Digital’s Data Steward Service, by checking and updating datasets for our internal and external stakeholders following written documentation.

Using Python to automate internal procedures and build new applications that allow the team to work faster and with less room for errors, including Excel spreadsheet validators and automated file checkers.
Building and maintaining SSIS packages and Python scripts to retrieve and process datasets.
Making changes to existing data pipelines according to stakeholder and government needs
Responding to email and IM queries from different stakeholders and customers in the team’s shared inbox.

work.name: Leeds City Council
highlights: Supporting Leeds City Council’s Business Continuity Team in the day-to-day operations of financial and document storage applications.
Handling and prioritising work orders and incidents for end-users, liaising with different external support teams as required.
Creating T-SQL scripts to compare application configurations across different servers.

Creating command line tools to aid with data transformation between applications and laborious administrative tasks – most recently creating a tool to check lists of users and remove their permissions from applications.
Organising and leading one-to-ones and twice-yearly appraisals as a line manager.

work.name: Leeds City Council
highlights: Managing Leeds City Council's in-house built case management system with responsibilities including application development, database management, and technical support.

Implemented new database functions to extract data for SSRS reports and built an SSRS report to generate T-SQL statements dynamically, dramatically reducing SSRS report writing times from days to hours.
Developing T-SQL scripts for administrative functions, such as adding and removing users; data and configuration migration between servers; and data quality checking and cleansing.
Spearheaded a project with the Information Governance team to set out and implement data retention policies based on service area, council and GDPR requirements.

Working with potential service areas to gather requirements in regard to understanding the data they wish to collect, then providing help and support on how to store it efficiently within the application, taking into data type and sensitivity, as well as the need for validation.
Writing technical documentation, such as configuration and report templates and onboarding/support guides for end users.
Leading meetings, workshops and handling support calls for a range of users with different technical backgrounds, adapting communication to best fit their needs.

work.name: Leeds City Council
work.summary: Working in different teams within the IDS directorate as part of the council's graduate programme

work.name: Northumbria University
work.summary: As an events rep, I am the first point of contact for many students on open days. My main responsibility is to answer visiting student's and parent's questions about the university, and more specifically, my course and faculty. Despite my focus on faculty, the role can require a more general involvement, for example by guiding groups of families around campus or facilities on tours; giving directions, and manning stalls in buildings to provide a friendly and welcoming atmosphere to prospective students.

work.name: Dubit Limited
work.summary: Placement year during university working as a QA Technician for the Interactive department at Dubit. Responsibilities included writing test suites and working alongside the development teams on a range of kids-orientated apps, games and websites for clients such as DreamWorks Animation and AFL.

work.name: Sodexo
work.summary: Collecting and washing glasses at one of St James'​ Park's Executive bars, this role gave me experience in working together in a tight-knit team in order to keep the bar running efficiently, as well as social skills and time management.

work.name: Northumbria Students' Union
work.summary: Setting up Northumbria's Student's Union for live events and activities, including Fresher's Week 2014 events, parties and game activities. This role gave me experience in setting up light and sound equipment and running popular night-time events, as well as a PASMA qualification.

volunteer.summary: I worked as a volunteer for Leeds' year of culture in 2023, volunteering at many of the city's landmark and third-party events, as well as partaking in recruitment and training of new volunteers.

Volunteering as part of one of many teams to help new first year students (freshers) in the first ten days of their semester. Tasks included moving students into halls, managing and providing support at SU-run events and ensuring that Fresher's Week ran smoothly as well as being friendly faces for the new students to come to with questions.

I helped build and refurbish two schools in rural parts of Kenya such as Rumuruti in Laikipia County. Tasks included painting and decorating rooms, refurbishing furniture, brickwork and roof laying. This was part of a 3 week excursion alongside around 90 other young people from Scouting in Yorkshire.

awards.title: Employment Skills for Placement (ESAP) Award
awards.summary: An award given to placement students by Northumbria's Engineering & Environment faculty. This award is optional and is awarded to students who write a report acknowledging the skills they gained while working in the industry.

awards.title: Excellent Placement Award
awards.summary: A graded award given to all students who complete a successful placement year during their third year of university. The award is assessed through monthly, quarterly and yearly reports written while on placement, as well as feedback from supervisors and other staff. My award was one of only two to be ranked as Excellent.
